decks.notes: This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a combination of powerful creatures and removal spells in the Rakdos colors. By utilizing cards like Bloodtithe Harvester and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse, the deck aims to quickly put pressure on the opponent while controlling the board with cards like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize. The deck also includes hand disruption spells like Duress to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to be proactive and disruptive in order to secure a quick victory.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt your opponent's hand and control the board early on with a mix of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress, removal spells like Fatal Push and Sheoldred's Edict, and versatile creatures like Valki, God of Lies and Cecil, Dark Knight. The deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent while keeping their options limited through a combination of aggressive plays and disruption. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive strategy while also allowing for a mix of colors for the cards in the deck.

The deck focuses on utilizing the cards Indomitable Creativity and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker to create powerful combos and overwhelming board presence. Atraxa, Grand Unifier and other supporting cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Prismari Command help control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes various spells and lands to support the combo pieces and ensure consistency. The goal is to quickly assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with a creative and powerful win condition.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on efficiently disrupting the opponent with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress, while quickly applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. The deck aims to maintain board control with removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat, and can also generate additional value with cards like Kolaghan's Command and Mutavault. Overall, the deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of disruption and aggression to secure a quick victory.

The main idea behind this deck is to control the game by utilizing a variety of removal spells, discard effects, and powerful enchantments to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The addition of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for extra value by flickering permanents for additional triggers. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent with card advantage and efficiently deal with threats on the board to ultimately establish dominance and secure the win.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on generating value through sacrificing creatures and spells to gain card advantage and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By utilizing cards like Witch's Oven, Scavenger's Talent, and Dredger's Insight, the deck aims to control the board while applying pressure with creatures like Gilded Goose and Cauldron Familiar. The inclusion of removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay helps to deal with opposing threats, while cards like Sephiroth, Fabled SOLDIER and Ygra, Eater of All provide additional power and versatility. The deck also features mana fixing and utility lands to ensure consistent gameplay.

The main concept of this Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan through a combination of powerful discard spells like Thoughtseize and Duress, removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat, and powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil. In addition, the deck aims to utilize creatures like Graveyard Trespasser and Gifted Aetherborn to apply pressure on the opponent while generating card advantage. The inclusion of cards like Cling to Dust and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse provides additional value and versatility to the deck's game plan. The deck also features land destruction elements with cards like Field of Ruin and Unholy Annex / Ritual Chamber to disrupt the opponent's mana base.

The main focus of this Mono Black Control Pioneer 1 vs 1 deck is to disrupt the opponent's hand and board through a combination of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress, removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat, and powerful control planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil. The deck also utilizes powerful finishers like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Graveyard Trespasser to close out the game. The mana base includes utility lands like Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth and Castle Locthwain to provide additional card advantage and mana fixing.

This Spirit Aggro deck focuses on utilizing low-cost creatures with powerful effects to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By controlling the battlefield with cards like Skyclave Apparition and Spell Queller, as well as protecting your creatures with Rattlechains and Sheltered by Ghosts, the deck aims to maintain pressure and tempo throughout the game. Mutavault provides extra versatility and reach, while Enduring Curiosity ensures a steady stream of card advantage. With a mix of evasion, disruption, and aggression, this deck aims to maintain a proactive game plan while keeping the opponent on the back foot.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing counterspells, removal, and card advantage to outvalue the opponent. This UW Control deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win condition with powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Narset, Parter of Veils. The addition of Kaheera as a companion provides additional value and synergy with the deck's strategy. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to maintain control of the game through disruption and card advantage until it can secure a victory.

The main concept of this Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan by hand disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Duress, while also controlling the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat. The deck also utilizes powerful threats like Graveyard Trespasser and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to pressure your opponent and close out the game. The deck aims to control the game through a combination of disruption, removal, and threats to outvalue and outlast the opponent.

This deck focuses on playing aggressively and quickly, using low-cost creatures and burn spells to deal damage to the opponent as fast as possible. It also includes a few versatile cards like Mutavault and Shadowspear to provide flexibility in combat situations. The key strategy is to maintain pressure on the opponent, while efficiently removing any threats they may play. Overall, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a relentless barrage of attacks and burn spells, leading to a swift victory.

The main focus of this UW Control deck is to manipulate the game in your favor by controlling the opponent's actions and resources. Utilizing cards like Dovin's Veto and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, along with counter spells and board wipes like Supreme Verdict, you aim to maintain board control while generating card advantage with Narset, Parter of Veils and Memory Deluge. The inclusion of Kaheera, the Orphanguard as a companion adds another layer of versatility to the deck. Ultimately, the goal is to outmaneuver and outlast your opponent to secure victory.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruption spells. The key strategy is to efficiently remove threats with cards like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat, while also applying pressure with cards like Bloodtithe Harvester and Blightstep Pathway. Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provide powerful late-game threats to close out the game. The deck also utilizes hand disruption with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The overall goal is to quickly establish a board presence and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This UW Control deck focuses on using a variety of cards to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck includes cards that allow for card advantage, counterspells, removal, and disruption. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional value through blinking permanents. The deck aims to stall the game with removal spells and counterspells until it can establish a win condition, such as Teferi, Hero of Dominaria or various other finishers. The mana base is well-balanced to support the deck's control strategy.

This deck focuses on using Enigmatic Incarnation to tutor for powerful creatures and enchantments, creating a strong control strategy. The deck includes powerful cards like Fires of Invention, Leyline Binding, and Temporary Lockdown to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of Keruga, the Macrosage as a companion ensures a steady stream of cards while following the deck's restrictions. The mana base is optimized with triomes and various lands to support the consistent casting of spells and creatures. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats.
